message_1: There are five people with either a black or white hat on. They cannot see their own hat, but they can see each other's hats. Each person is asked to guess the color of their own hat simultaneously, and they are not allowed to communicate. How many people need to correctly guess the color of their own hat for the group to win?
message_2: For the group to win, at least one person needs to correctly guess the color of their own hat. This is because there is no minimum number of correct guesses required for the group to win, as long as at least one person guesses correctly.
